reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Extended pre season week-end mid December: price (130chf incl breakfast) was extremely competitive, good service, youthful athmosphere, and relatively spacious rooms. Also nice wellness area with steambath, 2 saunas, hot tubs with nice view of the mountains. Obviously more expensive during peak season.
reviews.title: Central location, large rooms, nice Wellness area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel du Glacier and had a wonderful time. It is located in the Town Center and just a few minutes walk from the Alpin Express cableway station. Our room was on the top floor and was spacious enough (There was a roof-light which couldn't be closed which could be disturbing if you're a light sleeper). Free WiFi access is offered in all rooms. We had booked half board, the breakfast buffet always offered a choice of bread, cereals, egg bacon and more. Dinner was in either one of the two Restaurants and the 4-course meals were very tasty. The Spa / Fitness facilities are small but adequate and clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and always helpful. We really enjoyed our stay at the du Glacier!
reviews.title: A lovely hotel with excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du Glacier for four nights in September 2010. We'd driven to Saas Fee and parked in the large car park on the edge of town, so the hotel sent a little electric buggy to pick us up. Once at the hotel, our luggage was taken directly to our room whilst a friendly and efficient lady checked us in at the front desk.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (205) was large, bright, clean and in a generally well maintained condition, with a good sized bathroom and a small balcony facing the mountains and glaciers to the south.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over the New Year and absolutely loved it. The hotel itself is in a very good location, close to all ski lifts and cable-cars, we could even see 3 different cable-cars out of our window ( we had a glacier view). Hotel has marvellous jacuzzi, steam room and sauna, and they are not busy at all. Lying in a jacuzzi overlooking the glacier is a great experience. We haven`t booked a table for New Year`s Eve diiner and the hotel manager has kindly arranged for us to dine in a BBQ restaurant at the hotel, and we absolutely loved the food there. The room was always very clean and the breakfast buffet is large and enjoyable.There is absolutely nothing that we disliked. Wondeful place.
reviews.title: Excellent location and a wondeful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed in the DuGlacier at least 6 times over the years and held our wedding service in its dining room this August 2011.
reviews.title: Best value 4* in Saas Fee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean well appointed and the hotel is located right on the town square in Saas Fee close to the Alpine Express Gondola and the main supermarkets and bars. Allot of the rooms had fridges so you could store drinks and food for your backpack. They also provide free soft drinks in the mini bar.
reviews.title: 4 star but without things you would expect from a 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel is typical European fare with plenty of fresh fruit, cured meats and cereals. The coffee is fantastic.
reviews.title: Switzerland at its Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are this hotels biggest asset incredibly friendly and will do anything they can to facilitate your stay. Daniel and Santina are some of the best hotel staff I have ever meet and really do go out of their way to look after you.
reviews.title: splendid kitchen-very kind crew-good spa: recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a superb half board one week break and definitely made the correct choice. The location was ideal in the centre of everything and within minutes of all lifts and local transport. The friendly greeting we met on arrival was maintained throughout the week with first class service from the very professional and efficient staff. The meals ranging from the ample hot and cold buffet breakfast through to the high standard of the always varied menu choice for the evening meal cannot be criticised and the talents of the chef must be applauded. We enjoyed a glacier facing balcony room which was clean and comfortable and of good size providing so much more than just a bed, bath and wardrobe which can be the expectation.I can also say that the free local "Summer Pass" provided by the hotel was a tremendous bonus if no more than sometimes to jump the queue at the lift. All in all the break was a totally enjoyable stay in a perfect location. Thank you
reviews.title: Outstanding summer break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for a delightful week at this hotel on a half board basis.
reviews.title: Ice Breaker Crew make all the difference!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and food (choice and four courses for the evening meal plus wide selection of cooked and cold items for the buffet breakfast )within the restaurant were excellent.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well maintened throughout our stay.
reviews.title: The ultimate christmas experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location of the hotel is very good and the surrounding envions meant that it was quiet ;good views if you are located at the front of the hotel overlooking the glacier.
reviews.title: Very comfortable with friendly attentive staff and in a great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were a group of people taking up a few twin rooms and a single. All were of a good size. There is a fridge in the room.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location in town with the supermarket, rental shops and restaurants near by and not too far to walk to the ski lifts.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate in the Feeloch restaurant one evening and had a superb meal. The staff were fun too! Just make sure you don't end up sat right by the oven as I was roasting and only had on a small t-shirt.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location and friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was one of the best I have come across in this price range hotel in Switzerland.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here as part of an Inghams package holiday - so we don't have a direct opinion of the costs. The hotel tariff through this package included a pass that gave free access to all cable cars, chair lifts etc and the local buses. Reckon this saved us £300.
reviews.title: Great staff, great room, great value!
